info.title: Data Miner 2 Web API
info.description: Description for Data Miner 2 Web API

get.description: Gets the Lookup values for a specific field in a Feed.

parameters.name: feedKey
parameters.description: The Feed key.

parameters.name: fieldName
parameters.description: Name of the Field.

parameters.name: isActiveMetadata
parameters.description: if set to true [is active metadata].

200.description: Successfull searches will return the unique values stored in the Field for that Feed.

400.description: Lookup Feed or Field name is invalid.

404.description: The specified feed could not be found.

500.description: An unexpected error has occurred, please try the request again later.

get.description:
Searches the directory of feeds for any matching the provided search terms and returns some metadata describing the feeds.
This metadata includes links to search the feed and retreive additional metadata describing the feed and its' data.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
The search text to filter results by.  This will be used for partial, case-insensitive matches 
against either the feed's name or description.

parameters.name: rowCount
parameters.description:
Format - int32. Specifies the maximum number of results to include in the search result.
This is required if any other parameters are specified.

parameters.name: startRow
parameters.description:
Format - int32. Specifies the one-based number of the first record in the search results to be returned.
This is one-based, so 1 is the smallest value allowed and will return the very first record.
This is required if any other parameters are specified.

parameters.name: isFrequentlyAccessed
parameters.description: Specifies the feed is frequently used.

parameters.name: isActive
parameters.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is active.

200.description: Successfull searches will return metadata for the matching feeds, the search criteria used and paging information.

500.description: An unexpected error has occurred, please try the request again later.

post.description:

get.description: Searches the Actual/Schedule Summary Report feed.  Hourly actual, scheduled, and inadvertent flows by tie line for each hour

parameters.name: download
parameters.description:
Determines how results should be returned.  
            When true, only the results will be returned, no links or search criteria will be echoed.  Additionally, the total count will
            be returned in the HTTP Header X-TotalRows, a Content-Disposition header will be added triggering browsers to show a Save prompt,
            and the rowCount argument becomes optional.
            Note that there are still limits on the maximum rows that may be returned and, if that threshold is crossed, a 400 response will be returned.

parameters.name: rowCount
parameters.description:
Format - int64. Specifies the maximum number of results to include in the search result.
This is required if any other parameters are specified.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Specifies the name of the field to sort on.  Allowed values for this feed are:datetime_beginning_utc,
datetime_beginning_ept,
datetime_ending_utc,
datetime_ending_ept,
tie_line

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Specifies the direction to sort the field on.  
Allowed values are "asc" for ascending or "desc" for descending order.
The default value is "asc".

parameters.name: startRow
parameters.description:
Format - int64. Specifies the one-based number of the first record in the search results to be returned.
This is one-based, so 1 is the smallest value allowed and will return the very first record.
This is required if any other parameters are specified.

parameters.name: isActiveMetadata
parameters.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [active metadata only].

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Specifies the list of field names to retrieve in the form of a CSV list.  Allowed values for this feed are:datetime_beginning_utc,
datetime_beginning_ept,
datetime_ending_utc,
datetime_ending_ept,
tie_line,
actual_flow,
sched_flow,
inadv_flow

parameters.name: datetime_beginning_utc
parameters.description:
Restricts results to those that have a 'Datetime Beginning UTC' which falls inside the specified date range.  Datetime Beginning UTC. Allowed values are: Today,
LastWeek,
LastMonth,
Yesterday,
CurrentMonth,
CurrentWeek,
CurrentYear,
LastYear,
NextYear,
NextMonth,
NextWeek,
Tomorrow,
CurrentHour,
MonthsAgo4,
MonthsAgo6,
LastHour, [date-value] to [date-value].

parameters.name: datetime_beginning_ept
parameters.description:
Restricts results to those that have a 'Datetime Beginning EPT' which falls inside the specified date range.  Datetime Beginning EPT. Allowed values are: Today,
LastWeek,
LastMonth,
Yesterday,
CurrentMonth,
CurrentWeek,
CurrentYear,
LastYear,
NextYear,
NextMonth,
NextWeek,
Tomorrow,
CurrentHour,
MonthsAgo4,
MonthsAgo6,
LastHour, [date-value] to [date-value].

parameters.name: datetime_ending_utc
parameters.description:
Restricts results to those that have a 'Datetime Ending UTC' which falls inside the specified date range.  Datetime Ending UTC. Allowed values are: Today,
LastWeek,
LastMonth,
Yesterday,
CurrentMonth,
CurrentWeek,
CurrentYear,
LastYear,
NextYear,
NextMonth,
NextWeek,
Tomorrow,
CurrentHour,
MonthsAgo4,
MonthsAgo6,
LastHour, [date-value] to [date-value].

parameters.name: datetime_ending_ept
parameters.description:
Restricts results to those that have a 'Datetime Ending EPT' which falls inside the specified date range.  Datetime Ending EPT. Allowed values are: Today,

Yesterday,

CurrentWeek,

LastYear,
NextYear,
NextMonth,
NextWeek,
Tomorrow,
CurrentHour,
MonthsAgo4,
MonthsAgo6,
LastHour, [date-value] to [date-value].

parameters.name: tie_line
parameters.description: Restricts results to those that contain the specified value in the 'Tie Line' field. This performs a partial, case-insensitive match. Tie Line

200.description: Successful searches will return the matching feed items, the search criteria used, paging information, and links to related resources.

400.description: The search specification provided is invalid.

404.description: The specified feed could not be found.

500.description: An unexpected error has occurred, please try the request again later.

get.description: Searches the Generation Outage for Seven Days by Type feed.  This data contains the actual and scheduled megawatt generation outages for today and the next six days. In addition to providing total outages, the data show subtotals for each of the following outage types: unplanned (forced), maintenance, and planned. In order to provide a perspective on outages that are actually occurring or are scheduled to occur during the operating days, only outages with a status of active or approved are included.

get.description: Searches the Settlements Verified Hourly Ancillary LMPs feed.  This feed contains the verified hourly Ancillary Service Market prices used in settlements

parameters.name: download
parameters.description:
Determines how results should be returned.  
            When true, only the results will be returned, no links or search criteria will be echoed.  Additionally, the total count will
            be returned in the HTTP Header X-TotalRows, a Content-Disposition header will be added triggering browsers to show a Save prompt,
            and the rowCount argument becomes optional.
            Note that there are still limits on the maximum rows that may be returned and, if that threshold is crossed, a 400 response will be returned.

parameters.name: rowCount
parameters.description:
Format - int64. Specifies the maximum number of results to include in the search result.
This is required if any other parameters are specified.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Specifies the name of the field to sort on.  Allowed values for this feed are:datetime_beginning_utc,
datetime_beginning_ept

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Specifies the direction to sort the field on.  
Allowed values are "asc" for ascending or "desc" for descending order.
The default value is "asc".

parameters.name: startRow
parameters.description:
Format - int64. Specifies the one-based number of the first record in the search results to be returned.
This is one-based, so 1 is the smallest value allowed and will return the very first record.
This is required if any other parameters are specified.

parameters.name: isActiveMetadata
parameters.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [active metadata only].

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Specifies the list of field names to retrieve in the form of a CSV list.  Allowed values for this feed are:datetime_beginning_utc,
datetime_beginning_ept,
ancillary_service,
unit,
value

parameters.name: datetime_beginning_utc
parameters.description:
Restricts results to those that have a 'Datetime Beginning UTC' which falls inside the specified date range.  Datetime Beginning UTC. Allowed values are: Today,
LastWeek,
LastMonth,
Yesterday,
CurrentMonth,
CurrentWeek,
CurrentYear,
LastYear,
NextYear,
NextMonth,
NextWeek,
Tomorrow,
CurrentHour,
MonthsAgo4,
MonthsAgo6,
LastHour, [date-value] to [date-value].

parameters.name: datetime_beginning_ept
parameters.description:
Restricts results to those that have a 'Datetime Beginning EPT' which falls inside the specified date range.  Datetime Beginning EPT. Allowed values are: Today,
LastWeek,
LastMonth,
Yesterday,
CurrentMonth,
CurrentWeek,
CurrentYear,
LastYear,
NextYear,
NextMonth,
NextWeek,
Tomorrow,
CurrentHour,
MonthsAgo4,
MonthsAgo6,
LastHour, [date-value] to [date-value].

parameters.name: ancillary_service
parameters.description: Restricts results to those that contain the specified value in the 'Ancillary Service' field. This performs a partial, case-insensitive match. Type of ancillary service

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: Restricts results to those that contain the specified value in the 'Unit Type' field. This performs a partial, case-insensitive match. Price or Ratio
